title: Migrate Products to Firestore
description:
Currently, the entire product catalog is a static file (`src/lib/products.ts`). This task involves moving all product data into a 'products' collection in Firestore. 

**Data Handling:** Each product should be a separate document. This will allow admins to dynamically add, edit, and delete products from the admin panel instead of needing code changes. The public-facing product pages will then fetch data from this collection.

title: Migrate Blog Posts to Firestore
description:
Similar to products, all blog posts are currently hard-coded in the component files. This task is to move them to a 'blog' collection in Firestore. 

**Data Handling:** Each post will be a document containing its title, content (as HTML or Markdown), category, etc. This enables dynamic blog management from the admin panel.

title: Implement Firestore Security Rules
description:
This is a **critical security task**. We need to write and deploy comprehensive security rules for all Firestore collections. 

**Data Handling:** The rules will define who can read/write data. For example: 
- Users can only read/write their own documents in the `users` collection. 
- Only admins can write to `products` or `blog`. 
- Only admins can read the `logs` collection.

title: Build User Activity Timeline Page
description:
Create the dedicated page for viewing a single user's full activity log, which will be linked from the 'View all activity' button in the user management dialog. 

**Data Handling:** This page will query the `logs` collection, filtering for entries related to a specific `userId`.

title: Implement Real Appointment Booking
description:
Connect the 'Book Appointment' buttons to a Firestore collection. 

**Data Handling:** Create an `appointments` collection. When a user books, a new document will be created containing patientId, doctorId, requested time, etc. Admins will then be able to view and manage these appointments.

title: Integrate a Payment Gateway
description:
Integrate a real payment provider like Stripe or M-Pesa into the checkout page to handle financial transactions securely. 

**Data Handling:** This will likely involve creating a `orders` collection in Firestore to track payment status and order details.

title: Implement Cloud Functions for Notifications
description:
Write and deploy Firebase Cloud Functions to send real email/SMS notifications for important events. 

**Data Handling:** A function will trigger on document creation in collections like `refillRequests` or `orders`. It will then use a service like SendGrid or Twilio to dispatch the notification.

title: Develop Doctor/Driver Dashboards
description:
Create specialized, secure dashboard views for users with 'Doctor' or 'Delivery Driver' roles to manage their specific tasks (e.g., view assigned appointments, see delivery routes). 

**Data Handling:** This involves creating new pages and components that conditionally render based on the user's role.

title: User Authentication & Firestore Setup
description: Initial setup of Firebase Auth and core Firestore collections like users, logs, and refill requests. This foundational step enables user login/signup and data persistence.

title: Build Patient Dashboard
description: Create the main dashboard for logged-in patients. It dynamically shows a welcome message for new users and a 'day at a glance' timeline for returning users. It fetches data from the `users/{userId}/events` subcollection.

title: Categorize Logs
description: Implement a tabbed interface on the logs page to categorize logs (e.g., System, Admin, User). This will require adding a 'category' field to each log entry to allow for efficient filtering. This will make monitoring and debugging much easier.
